admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Credit Project
            aims to assist the country to maintain macroeconomic
            stability despite severe trade disruption and large inflows
            of refugees from Kosovo through financing of imports and
            government budget support. The project will provide
            immediate, quick-disbursing support to finance a positive
            list of imports needed for the recovery effort while
            supporting macroeconomic objectives. Also, the project will
            provide assistance for a broad range of imports by the
            private sector, especially imported production inputs and
            imported capital equipment. No disbursements will be made to
            cover used or luxury goods, military equipment, or nuclear
            reactors. The main benefit of the project is to provide
            financing for necessary imports despite a sharp drop in
            exports and a decline in private capital inflows and to
            allow for necessary budgetary expenditures related to
            refugees not covered by humanitarian relief agencies and
            related to the sharp economic downturn induced by the
            crisis. The major project risks are that the Kosovo conflict
            may continue, imposing ongoing debilitating effects on the
            region and requiring additional interventions by the
            international donor community.
